data.title: Every New Movie Trailer Released for Super Bowl 2024
data.meta_description: Watch all the new movie trailers from the 2024 Super Bowl, including Deadpool & Wolverine, A Quiet Place: Day One, and Wicked Part 1.
data.text:
The 2024 Super Bowl is bringing some exciting movie trailers to preview the year’s blockbuster slate. It is estimated that more than 100 million people will tune into Super Bowl LVIII, which pits the Kansas City Chiefs against the San Francisco 49ers in a rematch for the ages. The two NFL football teams previously met at Super Bowl LIV in 2020, wherein the Chiefs bested the 49ers 31 to 20. The Super Bowl is the most-watched American television broadcast of the year, and the numbers have only been on the rise with last year’s event surpassing over 115 million viewers. As such, Hollywood studios have to cough up a hefty price for live Super Bowl commercials, with a single 30-second TV spot now costing about 7 million.

So, which of the major studios coughed up the dough for 2024 Super Bowl trailers? Paramount had a huge presence, given that the big game aired on sister company CBS. In addition to heavily promoting their Paramount+ streaming service, including an already-released trailer of the Knuckles spin-off series, the studio showcased new looks at the prequel A Quiet Place: Day One, which comes from Pig filmmaker Michael Sarnoski, and writer-director John Krasinski’s new live-action-animated hybrid family comedy IF, starring Ryan Reynolds and Steve Carell. Paramount’s upcoming reggae biopic Bob Marley: One Love also had a presence with a big game spot.

People watching Super Bowl 2024 saw actor Ryan Reynolds more than once, as the highly-anticipated first trailer for Deadpool 3 – now officially titled Deadpool & Wolverine – has finally arrived. Featuring the return of Hugh Jackman as Wolverine, the word on the street is that the sequel will shake up the Marvel Universe (or Multiverse) as fans know it. On the note of Disney, new looks at Pixar’s Inside Out 2 and 20th Century Studios’ Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes were revealed. Universal is the third major studio that brought the heat this year, debuting new trailers for director David Leitch’s The Fall Guy, starring Ryan Gosling, Emily Blunt, and Aaron Taylor-Johnson, and director Lee Isaac Chung’s legacy sequel Twisters, starring Daisy Edgar-Jones, Glen Powell, and Anthony Ramos. Dev Patel’s Monkey Man, produced by Jordan Peele, made a surprise appearance with a new teaser as well.

Of course, Universal wouldn’t miss the 2024 Super Bowl without previewing Illumination‘s Despicable Me 4 and DreamWorks Animation’s Kung Fu Panda 4, which are surely going to be some of the biggest theater draws for families this year. The first trailer for Wicked Part 1 also premiered during the Super Bowl 2024. The cinematic adaptation of the hit Broadway musical comes from director Jon M. Chu (Crazy Rich Asians) and is on track to be Universal’s largest tentpole release during the 2024 holiday season, so it only made sense for moviegoers to get a first trailer tease during the 2024 Super Bowl.

Warner Bros., Sony, Netflix, and Amazon are skipped out on Super Bowl ads this year, despite blockbusters like Dune: Part Two, Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire, and Godzilla x Kong: The New Empire being just around the corner. Some of these studios usually sit out on releasing Super Bowl movie trailers to save money. Keep scrolling to see all the biggest movie trailers and big game spots released for the 2024 Super Bowl. We’ll keep updating this list LIVE with any surprises or last-minute changes as the Kansas City Chiefs battle the San Francisco 49ers throughout Super Bowl LVIII.

Super Bowl 2024 Movie Trailers

Deadpool & Wolverine

Release Date: July 26, 2024

Directed by Shawn Levy

Written by Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick, Zeb Wells, Ryan Reynolds, & Shawn Levy

Based on Deadpool by Fabian Nicieza & Rob Liefeld

Produced by Kevin Feige, Ryan Reynolds, Shawn Levy, & Simon Kinberg

Starring Ryan Reynolds, Hugh Jackman, Morena Baccarin, Brianna Hildebrand, Jennifer Garner, Leslie Uggams, Karan Soni, Stefan Kapičić, Shioli Kutsuna, Rob Delaney, Matthew Macfadyen, & Emma Corrin.

Distributed by Walt Disney Studios

A Quiet Place: Day One

Release Date: June 28, 2024

Directed by Michael Sarnoski

Screenplay by Michael Sarnoski

Story by John Krasinski & Michael Sarnoski

Based on characters by Bryan Woods & Scott Beck

Produced by Michael Bay, Andrew Form, Brad Fuller, & John Krasinski

Main Cast: Lupita Nyong’o, Joseph Quinn, Alex Wolff, & Djimon Hounsou

Distributor: Paramount Pictures

Wicked Part 1

Release Date: November 27, 2024

Directed by Jon M. Chu

Screenplay by Winnie Holzman & Stephen Schwartz

Based on characters from The Wonderful Wizard of Oz by L. Frank Baum

Produced by Marc Platt & David Stone

Main Cast: Cynthia Erivo, Ariana Grande, Jonathan Bailey, Ethan Slater, Marissa Bode, Michelle Yeoh, & Jeff Goldblum

Distributor: Universal Pictures

Inside Out 2

Release Date: June 14, 2024

Directed by Kelsey Mann

Written by Meg LeFauve

Produced by Mark Nielsen

Main Voice Cast: Amy Poehler, Phyllis Smith, Lewis Black, Tony Hale, Liza Lapira, Maya Hawke, & June Squibb

Distributor: Walt Disney Studios

Monkey Man

Release Date: April 5, 2024

Directed by Dev Patel

Screenplay by Dev Patel, Paul Angunawela, & John Collee

Story by Dev Patel

Produced by Dev Patel, Jomon Thomas, Jordan Peele, Win Rosenfeld, Ian Cooper, Basil Iwanyk, Erica Lee, Christine Haeble, & Anjay Nagpal

Main Cast: Dev Patel, Sharlto Copley, Pitobash, Sobhita Dhulipala, Sikandar Kher, Vipin Sharma, Ashwini Kalsekar, Adithi Kalkunte, & Makarand Deshpande

Distributor: Universal Pictures

Kung Fu Panda 4

Release Date: March 8, 2024

Directed by Mike Mitchell

Written by Jonathan Aibel & Glenn Berger

Produced by Rebecca Huntley

Main Voice Cast: Jack Black, Awkwafina, Viola Davis, Dustin Hoffman, James Hong, Bryan Cranston, Ian McShane, Lori Tan Chinn, Ronny Chieng, & Ke Huy Quan

Distributor: Universal Pictures

Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes

Release Date: May 10, 2024

Directed by Wes Ball

Written by Josh Friedman, Rick Jaffa, Amanda Silver, & Patrick Aison

Based on characters by Rick Jaffa & Amanda Silver with the premise suggested by Planet of the Apes by Pierre Boulle

Produced by Wes Ball, Joe Hartwick Jr., Rick Jaffa, Amanda Silver, & Jason Reed

Main Cast: Owen Teague, Freya Allan, Kevin Durand, Travis Jeffery, Lydia Peckham, Neil Sandilands, Peter Macon, & William H. Macy

Distributor: 20th Century Studios

The Fall Guy

Release Date: May 3, 2024

Directed by David Leitch

Written by Drew Pearce

Based on The Fall Guy by Glen A. Larson

Produced by Kelly McCormick, David Leitch, Ryan Gosling, & Guymon Casady

Main Cast: Ryan Gosling, Emily Blunt, Winston Duke, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Hannah Waddingham, Stephanie Hsu, & Teresa Palmer

Distributor: Universal Pictures

Twisters

Release Date: July 19, 2024

Directed by Lee Isaac Chung

Screenplay by Mark L. Smith

Based on characters by Michael Crichton & Anne-Marie Martin

Produced by Frank Marshall & Patrick Crowley

Main Cast: Daisy Edgar-Jones, Glen Powell, Anthony Ramos, Brandon Perea, Daryl McCormack, Maura Tierney, Harry Hadden-Paton, Sasha Lane, Kiernan Shipka, Nik Dodani, David Corenswet, Tunde Adebimpe, & Katy O’Brian

Distributor: Universal Pictures

Despicable Me 4

Release Date: July 3, 2024

Directed by Chris Renaud

Written by Mike White & Ken Daurio

Produced by Chris Meledandri & Brett Hoffman

Main Voice Cast: Steve Carell, Kristen Wiig, Will Ferrell, Miranda Cosgrove, Dana Gaier, Madison Polan, Sofía Vergara, Joey King, Stephen Colbert, Chloe Fineman, Pierre Coffin, & Steve Coogan

Distributor: Universal Pictures

IF

Release Date: May 17, 2024

Directed by John Krasinski

Written by John Krasinski

Produced by John Krasinski, Allyson Seeger, Andrew Form, & Ryan Reynolds

Main Cast: Ryan Reynolds, John Krasinski, Cailey Fleming, Fiona Shaw, Alan Kim, Liza Colón-Zayas, & Bobby Moynihan

Main Voice Cast: Steve Carell, Phoebe Waller-Bridge, Louis Gossett Jr., Emily Blunt, Matt Damon, Maya Rudolph, Jon Stewart, Sam Rockwell, Sebastian Maniscalco, Christopher Meloni, Richard Jenkins, Awkwafina, & Vince Vaughn

Distributor: Paramount Pictures

Bob Marley: One Love
